subject: Politics
title: Social Liberalism
description: A quick, practical guide to Social Liberalism.

hook.text: Classical liberals said government should stay out. Social liberals said sometimes government must step in.

buildup.text: By the 1900s, unregulated capitalism created extreme poverty. Liberals split on whether the state should help.

discovery.text: Social liberals support public education, healthcare, and safety nets. Freedom means nothing if you're starving.

twist.text: In America, 'liberal' means social liberal. In Europe, it often still means free-market classical liberal.

climax.text: FDR's New Deal was social liberalism in action: government programs to fight poverty and unemployment.

punchline.text: Social liberals want freedom from want, not just freedom from government.

quiz.question: How does social liberalism differ from classical liberalism?
options: It supports government intervention to ensure equality and basic needs
It opposes all government involvement in the economy
